tldr: The authors conducted experiments on a two-disk machine to study the behavior of elastohydrodynamic lubrication and the relation between shear stress and shear rate. They discovered that the lubricant exhibits non-Newtonian behavior when a critical level of stress is exceeded, and the magnitude of the shear rate is of secondary importance. The findings contribute to the development of a rheological model for lubricants in elastohydrodynamic conditions.
